content.title: National Award For Senior Citizens (Vayoshreshtha Samman): Lifetime Achievement
content.department: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
content.details: Every year, the Department of Social Justice and Empowerment, Government of India confers the 'National Award for Senior Citizens (Vayoshreshtha Samman)' to the eminent and outstanding senior citizens and institutions/organizations involved in rendering distinguished service for the cause of elderly persons, especially indigent senior citizens. The awards are conferred on 1st October every year by the Hon’ble President of India at Vigyan Bhawan, New Delhi. The 'Lifetime Achievement Award' is conferred to senior citizens, preferably above seventy years, who have worked in the field of ageing and made significant contributions in the field. A total of 11 awards are given along with a Certificate, a Memento and also Cash Award.
eligibility: Senior citizens, preferably above seventy years, who have made significant contributions to society, especially to the elderly.
The upliftment and betterment of the lives of the elderly in society.
Outstanding achievement in the field of education or research or publication and work performance etc.
Provide pioneering or innovative programmes and services in the social welfare sector.
Recognised as a role model for exemplary contribution to the community and society at large.
documents_required: Proof of Educational Qualification (Passing Certificate, Marksheet)
Details of work done in the last three years in the field
Details of Awards and Honours Received

faqs.question: What are the objectives of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of this scheme is to honour the eminent and outstanding senior citizens and institutions/organizations involved in rendering distinguished service for the cause of elderly persons, especially indigent senior citizens.

faqs.question: When are these awards conferred?
faqs.answer: The awards are conferred on 1st October every year.

faqs.question: Who confers these awards?
faqs.answer: The awards are conferred by the Hon’ble President of India at Vigyan Bhawan, New Delhi.

faqs.question: How many categories are there in this award?
faqs.answer: The Awards are given across 13 categories: 07 Institutional Categories and 06 categories of individual type.

faqs.question: Can I nominate myself for this award?
faqs.answer: No, Self-nominations for the Awards shall not be considered.
